column4: I was called to Freenode chatroom #ubuntu by the one known as nictrasavios. My brother informed me of an issue, how may i be of service.
Are the ones who require my assistance here? or shall i take my leave.
Are you a multi-system expert?
yes, that's me.
Yes i am. I am knowlageable in Unix, Linux and DOS systems, aswell as all their roots.
what seems to be your issue.
I have a big Vista partition, and I need to get my big files (like mysql databases) onto my big Vista NTFS partition
why not resize the partitions? or e
I mounted my Vista partion in fstab as # NTFS Windows VistapPartition (?)
Because UltraDefrag couldn't move some stuff near the end
i would do a full system defrag on windows, then use gParted to shrink. But that is besides the point. What is the issue you are having, it its most simple form of explanation.
I'm trying to follow these instructions to move my databases, but the chmod doesn't take ... http://www.ubuntu-howto.info/howto/how-to-move-mysql-databases-to-another-location-partition-or-hard-drive
this stinks of a problem i had on my very first ubuntu installation. I was unable to change any permissions for a few arbitrary files.
hmm. So your trying to move your database from one Linux to the next.
it never came back, but anyway. So your moving the database from one linux to the next? I belive NS said you were trying to move it to windows?

i could not make out his words, he seems in a hurry. But if he was correct, then i must inform you that you cannot simply "copy and paste" your database from one system to the next. Only if the systems are of the same operating system.
you would have to export your database, rebuild your configuration, then import your database back in.
I see.
with but few exceptions, you cannot simply take somthing working in linux, and copy it into windows. For more reasons then it is worth listing.

if at all possible, i would find a equal or better to all your windows needs, then delete vista and become a "pure" ubuntu user. As someone who uses all three systems everyday... i can say with great confidence that windows is, and always will be, a horrible system to its very core. From the kernel to the userland, it wreaks of horrible code.

windows was never ment to be used in todays world, it was build to be a stand alone system, with no internet. You set it up, and use it. Everything put into it was ment to be put in via CD or other input. Thus, it cannot survive in a modern world.
if you must use it, i suggest virtual box.  Anyway , i must take my leave. I am needed elsewhere.
